arm_group.description: Patients undergoing elective colorectal procedures with an Enhanced Recovery Program. Orthogonal polarization spectral (OPS) imaging will be used to measure sublingual microcirculation

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this pilot study is to establish if a correlation between sub-lingual
      microcirculation measured by Orthogonal polarization spectral (OPS) imaging and symptoms of
      postoperative ileus exist in patients undergoing elective colorectal surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
AIM OF THE STUDY This observational study will assess whether perioperative microcirculatory
      changes can be correlated with symptoms associated with primary POI.

      PRIMARY RESEARCH QUESTION Is there a correlation between peri-operative microcirculatory
      flow measurements and the incidence of symptomatic primary POI?

      SECONDARY RESEARCH QUESTIONS

        1. Is there a correlation between peri-operative microcirculatory flow measurements and
           the duration of symptomatic primary POI?

        2. If any correlation is observed, which anatomic location (sublingual mucosa vs bowel
           serosa) yields microcirculatory flow measurements that are more strongly associated
           with the incidence and/or duration of symptomatic primary POI?

        3. Can either intraoperative sublingual mucosa or intraoperative bowel serosa
           microcirculatory flow measurements predict symptoms of primary POI? Are these two
           anatomic locations equivalent in their ability to predict this complication?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients older than 18 yo undergoing elective laparoscopic colorectal surgery with an
             Enhanced Recovery Program (ERP) at the Montreal General Hospital

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any patient who refuses enrolment

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing elective colorectal surgery with an Enhanced Recovery Program (ERP)

intervention.description: orthogonal polarization spectral (OPS) imaging allows noninvasive observation of human microcirculation in all accessible tissue surfaces

clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Sublingual Microcirculation and Postoperative Ileus Symptoms in Patients Undergoing Colorectal Surgery - a Pilot Study

primary_outcome.description:
Patients will be considered having POI symptoms if at least one symptom, for each of the following criteria, will be reported:
i. Vomiting (+/- nausea) OR abdominal distension AND ii. Absence of passing gas/stool OR not tolerating oral diet.
Microvascular flow index (MFI) score: this score is based on determination of the predominant type of flow observed. Flow is characterized as absent (0), intermittent (1), sluggish (2), or normal (3).
primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative ileus symptoms;  microvascular flow index (MFI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 days
